Description: The board of directors or executive committee defines clear roles and responsibilities for cyber security both within the board of directors or executive committee and broadly within their organisation.
Title from Copilot: Board defines cyber security roles & responsibilities

Description: The board of directors or executive committee ensures that cyber security is integrated throughout all business functions within their organisation.
Title from Copilot: Board integrates cyber security throughout business functions

Description: The board of directors or executive committee ensures the cyber security strategy for their organisation is aligned with the overarching strategic direction and business strategy for their organisation.
Title from Copilot: Cyber strategy aligned with business strategy

Description: The board of directors or executive committee seeks regular briefings or reporting on the cyber security posture of their organisation, as well as the threat environment in which they operate, from internal and external subject matter experts.
Title from Copilot: Board seeks regular cyber posture briefings

Description: The board of directors or executive committee champions a positive cyber security culture within their organisation, including through leading by example.
Title from Copilot: Board champions positive cyber security culture

Description: The board of directors or executive committee maintains a sufficient level of cyber security literacy to fulfil both their fiduciary duties and any legislative or regulatory obligations.
Title from Copilot: Board maintains cyber security literacy

Description: The board of directors or executive committee maintains awareness of key cyber security recruitment activities, retention rates for cyber security personnel, and cyber security skills and experience gaps within their organisation.
Title from Copilot: Board monitors cyber recruitment and skills gaps

Description: The board of directors or executive committee supports the development of cyber security skills and experience for all personnel via internal and external cyber security awareness raising and training opportunities.
Title from Copilot: Board supports cyber security training for personnel

Description: The board of directors or executive committee understands the business criticality of their organisation’s systems, including at least a basic understanding of what exists, their value, where they reside, who has access, who might seek access, how they are protected, and how that protection is verified.
Title from Copilot: Board understands business-critical systems

Description: The board of directors or executive committee plans for major cyber security incidents, including by participating in exercises, and understand their duties in relation to such cyber security incidents.
Title from Copilot: Board plans for major cyber incidents

Description: A CISO is appointed to provide cyber security leadership and guidance for their organisation (covering information technology and operational technology).
Title from Copilot: CISO appointed for cyber leadership

Description: The CISO oversees their organisation’s cyber security program and ensures their organisation’s compliance with cyber security policy, standards, regulations and legislation.
Title from Copilot: CISO oversees cyber program and compliance

Description: The CISO regularly reviews and updates their organisation’s cyber security program to ensure its relevance in addressing cyber threats and harnessing business and cyber security opportunities.
Title from Copilot: CISO regularly updates cyber program

Description: The CISO develops, implements, maintains and verifies on a regular basis a register of systems used by their organisation.
Title from Copilot: CISO maintains register of systems

Description: The CISO implements cyber security measurement metrics and key performance indicators for their organisation.
Title from Copilot: CISO implements cyber KPIs and metrics

Description: The CISO coordinates cyber security and business alignment through a cyber security steering committee or advisory board, comprising of key cyber security and business executives, which meets formally and on a regular basis.
Title from Copilot: CISO runs cyber steering committee

Description: The CISO coordinates security risk management activities between cyber security and business teams.
Title from Copilot: CISO coordinates security risk management

Description: The CISO regularly reports directly to their organisation’s board of directors or executive committee on cyber security matters.
Title from Copilot: CISO reports to board on cyber matters

Description: The CISO regularly reports directly to their organisation’s audit, risk and compliance committee (or equivalent) on cyber security matters.
Title from Copilot: CISO reports to audit/risk/compliance committee

Description: The CISO is fully aware of all cyber security incidents within their organisation.
Title from Copilot: CISO aware of all cyber incidents

Description: The CISO oversees their organisation’s response to cyber security incidents.
Title from Copilot: CISO oversees incident response

Description: The CISO contributes to the development, implementation and maintenance of business continuity and disaster recovery plans for their organisation to ensure that business-critical services are supported appropriately in the event of a disaster.
Title from Copilot: CISO contributes to business continuity planning

Description: The CISO oversees the development, implementation and maintenance of a cyber security communications strategy to assist in communicating the cyber security vision and strategy for their organisation.
Title from Copilot: CISO oversees cyber communications strategy

Description: The CISO oversees cyber supply chain risk management activities for their organisation.
Title from Copilot: CISO manages cyber supply chain risk

Description: The CISO receives and manages a dedicated cyber security budget for their organisation.
Title from Copilot: CISO manages dedicated cyber budget

Description: The CISO oversees the management of cyber security personnel within their organisation.
Title from Copilot: CISO manages cyber personnel

Description: The CISO ensures sufficient cyber security personnel, with the right skills and experience, are acquired to support cyber security activities within their organisation.
Title from Copilot: CISO ensures sufficient cyber staffing

Description: The CISO oversees the development, implementation and maintenance of their organisation’s cyber security awareness training program.
Title from Copilot: CISO oversees cyber awareness training program

Description: Each system has a designated system owner.
Title from Copilot: Each system has an owner

Description: System owners register each system with its authorising officer.
Title from Copilot: System owners register systems with approver

Description: System owners, in consultation with each system’s authorising officer, determine the system boundary, business criticality and security objectives for each system based on an assessment of the impact if it were to be compromised.
Title from Copilot: System owners define boundary & criticality

Description: System owners, in consultation with each system’s authorising officer, conduct a threat and risk assessment for each system.
Title from Copilot: System owners conduct system threat & risk assessment

Description: System owners, in consultation with each system’s authorising officer, select controls for each system and tailor them to achieve desired security objectives.
Title from Copilot: System owners select and tailor controls

Description: System owners, in consultation with each system’s authorising officer, identify any supplementary controls required based upon the unique nature of each system, its operating environment and the organisation’s risk tolerances.
Title from Copilot: System owners identify supplementary controls

Description: System owners implement controls for each system and its operating environment.
Title from Copilot: System owners implement system controls

Description: System owners, in consultation with each system’s authorising officer, ensure controls for each non-classified, OFFICIAL: Sensitive, PROTECTED and SECRET system and its operating environment undergo a security assessment by their organisation’s own assessors or Infosec Registered Assessor Program (IRAP) assessors to determine if they have been implemented correctly and are operating as intended.
Title from Copilot: Systems undergo security assessment by IRAP/org assessors

Description: System owners, in consultation with each system’s authorising officer, ensure controls for each TOP SECRET system and its operating environment, including each sensitive compartmented information system and its operating environment, undergo a security assessment by ASD assessors (or their delegates) to determine if they have been implemented correctly and are operating as intended.
Title from Copilot: TOP SECRET systems assessed by ASD assessors

Description: System owners obtain authorisation to operate each non-classified, OFFICIAL: Sensitive, PROTECTED and SECRET system from its authorising officer based on the acceptance of the security risks associated with its operation.
Title from Copilot: System owners obtain authorisation to operate (non-TS)

Description: System owners obtain authorisation to operate each TOP SECRET system, including each sensitive compartmented information system, from Director-General ASD (or their delegate) based on the acceptance of the security risks associated with its operation.
Title from Copilot: TOP SECRET systems authorised by Director-General ASD

Description: System owners monitor each system, and associated cyber threats, security risks and controls, on an ongoing basis.
Title from Copilot: System owners continuously monitor systems

Description: System owners implement and maintain data minimisation practices for each of their systems.
Title from Copilot: System owners implement data minimisation

Description: System owners report the security status of each system to its authorising officer at least annually.
Title from Copilot: System owners report security status annually

Description: A cyber security incident management policy, and associated cyber security incident response plan, is developed, implemented and maintained.
Title from Copilot: Incident management policy and response plan maintained

Description: The cyber security incident management policy, including the associated cyber security incident response plan, is exercised at least annually.
Title from Copilot: Incident management plan exercised annually

Description: A cyber security incident register is developed, implemented and maintained.
Title from Copilot: Cyber incident register maintained

Description:
A cyber security incident register contains the following for each cyber security incident:
• the date the cyber security incident occurred
• the date the cyber security incident was discovered
• a description of the cyber security incident
• any actions taken in response to the cyber security incident
• to whom the cyber security incident was reported.
Title from Copilot: Incident register records key incident details

Description: An insider threat mitigation program is developed, implemented and maintained.
Title from Copilot: Insider threat mitigation program maintained

Description: Legal advice is sought regarding the development and implementation of an insider threat mitigation program.
Title from Copilot: Legal advice sought for insider program

Description: Cyber security personnel have access to sufficient data sources and tools to ensure that systems can be monitored for key indicators of compromise.
Title from Copilot: Cyber personnel have adequate monitoring data/tools

Description: Cyber security incidents are reported to the chief information security officer, or one of their delegates, as soon as possible after they occur or are discovered.
Title from Copilot: Incidents reported to CISO promptly

Description: Cyber security incidents are reported to ASD as soon as possible after they occur or are discovered.
Title from Copilot: Incidents reported to ASD promptly

Description: Cyber security incidents that involve customer data are reported to customers and the public in a timely manner after they occur or are discovered.
Title from Copilot: Customer-data incidents reported to customers/public

Description: Cyber security incidents that do not involve customer data are reported to customers and the public in a timely manner after they occur or are discovered.
Title from Copilot: Non-customer-data incidents reported to customers/public

Description: Following the identification of a cyber security incident, the cyber security incident response plan is enacted.
Title from Copilot: Incident response plan enacted after identification

Description: When a data spill occurs, data owners are advised and access to the data is restricted.
Title from Copilot: Data owners advised and access restricted after spill

Description:
When malicious code is detected, the following steps are taken to handle the infection:
• the infected systems are isolated
• all previously connected media used in the period leading up to the infection are scanned for signs of infection and isolated if necessary
• antivirus applications are used to remove the infection from infected systems and media
• if the infection cannot be reliably removed, systems are restored from a known good backup or rebuilt.
Title from Copilot: Malicious code handling and remediation steps

Description: Malicious code, when stored or communicated, is treated beforehand to prevent accidental execution.
Title from Copilot: Stored/communicated malicious code treated before use

Description: Malicious code processed for cyber security incident response or research purposes is done so in a dedicated analysis environment that is segregated from other systems.
Title from Copilot: Malicious code analysed in segregated environment

Description: Legal advice is sought before allowing intrusion activity to continue on a system for the purpose of collecting further data or evidence.
Title from Copilot: Legal advice before allowing intrusion collection to continue

Description: System owners are consulted before allowing intrusion activity to continue on a system for the purpose of collecting further data or evidence.
Title from Copilot: System owners consulted before intrusion data collection

Description: Planning and coordination of intrusion remediation activities are conducted on a separate system to that which has been compromised.
Title from Copilot: Intrusion remediation planning on separate system

Description: To the extent possible, all intrusion remediation activities are conducted in a coordinated manner during the same planned outage.
Title from Copilot: Coordinate intrusion remediation during planned outage

Description: Following intrusion remediation activities, full network traffic is captured for at least seven days and analysed to determine whether malicious actors have been successfully removed from the system.
Title from Copilot: Post-remediation full network traffic capture & analysis

Description:
The integrity of evidence gathered during an investigation is maintained by investigators:
• recording all of their actions
• maintaining a proper chain of custody
• following all instructions provided by relevant law enforcement agencies.
Title from Copilot: Investigators maintain evidence integrity and chain of custody

Description: Suppliers of operating systems, applications, IT equipment, OT equipment and services associated with systems are identified.
Title from Copilot: Suppliers of systems and services identified

Description: A supply chain risk assessment is performed for suppliers of operating systems, applications, IT equipment, OT equipment and services in order to assess the impact to a system’s security risk profile.
Title from Copilot: Supplier supply chain risk assessment performed

Description: Suppliers identified as high risk by a cyber supply chain risk assessment are not used.
Title from Copilot: High-risk suppliers not used

Description: Operating systems, applications, IT equipment, OT equipment and services are procured from suppliers that have demonstrated a commitment to the security of their products and services.
Title from Copilot: Procure from security-focused suppliers

Description: Operating systems, applications, IT equipment, OT equipment and services are procured from suppliers that have demonstrated a commitment to transparency for their products and services.
Title from Copilot: Procure from suppliers demonstrating transparency

Description: Operating systems, applications, IT equipment, OT equipment and services are procured from suppliers that have a strong track record of maintaining the security of their own systems.
Title from Copilot: Procure from suppliers with strong security track record

Description: A shared responsibility model is created, documented and shared between suppliers and their customers in order to articulate the security responsibilities of each party.
Title from Copilot: Create shared responsibility model with suppliers

Description: A supplier relationship management policy is developed, implemented and maintained.
Title from Copilot: Supplier relationship management policy maintained

Description: An approved supplier list is developed, implemented and maintained.
Title from Copilot: Approved supplier list maintained

Description: Operating systems, applications, IT equipment, OT equipment and services are sourced from approved suppliers.
Title from Copilot: Source from approved suppliers

Description: Multiple potential suppliers are identified for sourcing critical operating systems, applications, IT equipment, OT equipment and services.
Title from Copilot: Identify multiple suppliers for critical systems

Description: Sufficient spares of critical IT equipment and OT equipment are sourced and kept in reserve.
Title from Copilot: Keep spares of critical IT/OT equipment

Description: Operating systems, applications, IT equipment, OT equipment and services are delivered in a manner that maintains their integrity.
Title from Copilot: Supplies delivered maintaining integrity

Description: The integrity of operating systems, applications, IT equipment, OT equipment and services are assessed as part of acceptance of products and services.
Title from Copilot: Assess integrity during product acceptance

Description: The authenticity of operating systems, applications, IT equipment, OT equipment and services are assessed as part of acceptance of products and services.
Title from Copilot: Assess authenticity during product acceptance

Description: A managed service register is developed, implemented, maintained and verified on a regular basis.
Title from Copilot: Managed service register maintained

Description:
A managed service register contains the following for each managed service:
• managed service provider’s name
• managed service’s name
• purpose for using the managed service
• sensitivity or classification of data involved
• due date for the next security assessment of the managed service
• contractual arrangements for the managed service
• point of contact for users of the managed service
• 24/7 contact details for the managed service provider.
Title from Copilot: Managed service register contains required details

Description: Managed service providers and their non-classified, OFFICIAL: Sensitive, PROTECTED and SECRET managed services undergo an Infosec Registered Assessor Program (IRAP) assessment, using the latest release of the ISM available prior to the beginning of the IRAP assessment (or a subsequent release), at least every 24 months.
Title from Copilot: Managed services undergo IRAP assessment every 24 months

Description: Managed service providers and their TOP SECRET managed services, including sensitive compartmented information managed services, undergo a security assessment by ASD assessors (or their delegates), using the latest release of the ISM available prior to the beginning of the security assessment (or a subsequent release), at least every 24 months.
Title from Copilot: TOP SECRET managed services assessed by ASD every 24 months

Description: An outsourced cloud service register is developed, implemented, maintained and verified on a regular basis.
Title from Copilot: Outsourced cloud service register maintained

Description:
An outsourced cloud service register contains the following for each outsourced cloud service:
• cloud service provider’s name
• cloud service’s name
• purpose for using the cloud service
• sensitivity or classification of data involved
• due date for the next security assessment of the cloud service
• contractual arrangements for the cloud service
• point of contact for users of the cloud service
• 24/7 contact details for the cloud service provider.
Title from Copilot: Cloud register contains required cloud service details

Description: Only community or private clouds are used for outsourced SECRET and TOP SECRET cloud services.
Title from Copilot: Use private/community clouds for SECRET/TOP SECRET

Description: Outsourced cloud service providers and their non-classified, OFFICIAL: Sensitive, PROTECTED and SECRET cloud services undergo an IRAP assessment, using the latest release of the ISM available prior to the beginning of the IRAP assessment (or a subsequent release), at least every 24 months.
Title from Copilot: Cloud services undergo IRAP assessment every 24 months

Description: Outsourced cloud service providers and their TOP SECRET cloud services, including sensitive compartmented information cloud services, undergo a security assessment by ASD assessors (or their delegates), using the latest release of the ISM available prior to the beginning of the security assessment (or a subsequent release), at least every 24 months.
Title from Copilot: TOP SECRET cloud services assessed by ASD every 24 months

Description: Service providers, including any subcontractors, provide an appropriate level of protection for any data entrusted to them or their services.
Title from Copilot: Service providers protect entrusted data

Description: Security requirements associated with the confidentiality, integrity and availability of data are documented in contractual arrangements with service providers and reviewed on a regular and ongoing basis to ensure they remain fit for purpose.
Title from Copilot: Security requirements documented in contracts with providers

Description: The right to verify compliance with security requirements is documented in contractual arrangements with service providers.
Title from Copilot: Right to verify compliance documented in contracts

Description: The right to verify compliance with security requirements documented in contractual arrangements with service providers is exercised on a regular and ongoing basis.
Title from Copilot: Right to verify compliance exercised regularly

Description: Break clauses associated with failure to meet security requirements are documented in contractual arrangements with service providers.
Title from Copilot: Break clauses for security failures in contracts

Description: The requirement for service providers to report cyber security incidents to a designated point of contact as soon as possible after they occur or are discovered is documented in contractual arrangements with service providers.
Title from Copilot: Providers must report incidents to designated contact

Description: A minimum notification period of one month by service providers for significant changes to their own service provider arrangements is documented in contractual arrangements with service providers.
Title from Copilot: One-month notification period for provider changes

Description: Types of data and its ownership is documented in contractual arrangements with service providers.
Title from Copilot: Data types and ownership documented in contracts

Description: The regions or availability zones where data will be processed, stored and communicated, as well as a minimum notification period for any configuration changes, is documented in contractual arrangements with service providers.
Title from Copilot: Regions/availability zones and change notification documented

Description: Access to all logs relating to an organisation’s data and services is documented in contractual arrangements with service providers.
Title from Copilot: Access to logs documented in contracts

Description: The storage of data in a portable manner that allows for backups, service migration and service decommissioning without any loss of data is documented in contractual arrangements with service providers.
Title from Copilot: Portable storage and backup/migration documented in contracts

Description: A minimum notification period of one month for the cessation of any services by a service provider is documented in contractual arrangements with service providers.
Title from Copilot: One-month notification for service cessation documented

Description: An organisation’s systems are not accessed or administered by a service provider unless a contractual arrangement exists between the organisation and the service provider to do so.
Title from Copilot: Service providers only access systems under contract

Description: If an organisation’s systems are accessed or administered by a service provider in an unauthorised manner, the organisation is immediately notified.
Title from Copilot: Immediate notification for unauthorised provider access

Description: A cyber security strategy is developed, implemented and maintained.
Title from Copilot: Cyber security strategy maintained

Description: Organisational-level cyber security documentation is approved by the chief information security officer while system-specific cyber security documentation is approved by the system’s authorising officer.
Title from Copilot: CISO approves organisation-level cyber docs; AO approves system docs

Description: A system’s security architecture is approved prior to the development of the system.
Title from Copilot: System security architecture approved pre-development

Description: Cyber security documentation is reviewed at least annually and includes a ‘current as at [date]’ or equivalent statement.
Title from Copilot: Cyber documentation reviewed at least annually

Description: Cyber security documentation, including notification of subsequent changes, is communicated to all stakeholders.
Title from Copilot: Cyber docs and change notifications communicated to stakeholders

Description: Systems have a system security plan that includes an overview of the system (covering the system’s purpose, the system boundary and how the system is managed) as well as an annex that covers applicable controls from this document and any additional controls that have been identified and implemented.
Title from Copilot: System security plan includes overview and control annex

Description:
Systems have a cyber security incident response plan that covers the following:
• guidelines on what constitutes a cyber security incident
• the types of cyber security incidents likely to be encountered and the expected response to each type
• how to report cyber security incidents, internally to an organisation and externally to relevant authorities
• other parties which need to be informed in the event of a cyber security incident
• the authority, or authorities, responsible for investigating and responding to cyber security incidents
• the criteria by which an investigation of a cyber security incident would be requested from a law enforcement agency, the Australian Signals Directorate or other relevant authority
• the steps necessary to ensure the integrity of evidence relating to a cyber security incident
• system contingency measures or a reference to such details if they are located in a separate document.
Title from Copilot: System cyber incident response plan contains required elements

Description:
Systems have a change and configuration management plan that includes:
• the establishment and maintenance of authorised baseline configurations for systems
• what constitutes routine and urgent changes to the configuration of systems
• how changes to the configuration of systems will be requested, tracked and documented
• who needs to be consulted prior to routine and urgent changes to the configuration of systems
• who needs to approve routine and urgent changes to the configuration of systems
• who needs to be notified of routine and urgent changes to the configuration of systems
• what additional change management and configuration management processes and procedures need to be followed before, during and after routine and urgent changes to the configuration of systems.
Title from Copilot: Change & configuration management plan contains required elements

Description:
Systems have a continuous monitoring plan that includes:
• conducting vulnerability scans for systems at least fortnightly
• conducting vulnerability assessments and penetration tests for systems prior to deployment, including prior to deployment of significant changes, and at least annually thereafter
• analysing identified vulnerabilities to determine their potential impact
• implementing mitigations based on risk, effectiveness and cost.
Title from Copilot: Continuous monitoring plan with scanning and testing requirements

Description:
At the conclusion of a security assessment for a system, a security assessment report is produced by the assessor and covers:
• the scope of the security assessment
• the system’s strengths and weaknesses
• security risks associated with the operation of the system
• the effectiveness of the implementation of controls
• any recommended remediation actions.
Title from Copilot: Security assessment report produced after assessment

Description: At the conclusion of a security assessment for a system, a plan of action and milestones is produced by the system owner.
Title from Copilot: Plan of action and milestones produced after assessment

Description: Non-classified systems are secured in suitably secure facilities.
Title from Copilot: Non-classified systems secured in suitable facilities

Description: Classified systems are secured in facilities that meet the requirements for a security zone suitable for their classification.
Title from Copilot: Classified systems secured in suitable security-zone facilities

Description: Non-classified servers, network devices and cryptographic equipment are secured in suitably secure server rooms or communications rooms.
Title from Copilot: Non-classified servers and cryptographic equipment in secure rooms

Description: Classified servers, network devices and cryptographic equipment are secured in server rooms or communications rooms that meet the requirements for a security zone suitable for their classification.
Title from Copilot: Classified servers in rooms meeting classification zone requirements

Description: Non-classified servers, network devices and cryptographic equipment are secured in suitably secure security containers.
Title from Copilot: Non-classified equipment secured in containers

Description: Classified servers, network devices and cryptographic equipment are secured in security containers suitable for their classification taking into account the combination of security zones they reside in.
Title from Copilot: Classified equipment secured in suitable containers

Description: Server rooms, communications rooms and security containers are not left in unsecured states.
Title from Copilot: Server/communications rooms not left unsecured

Description: Keys or equivalent access mechanisms to server rooms, communications rooms and security containers are appropriately controlled.
Title from Copilot: Keys to secure rooms appropriately controlled

Description: Physical security is implemented to protect network devices in public areas from physical damage or unauthorised access.
Title from Copilot: Physical security protects network devices in public areas

Description: An authorised RF and IR device register for SECRET and TOP SECRET areas is developed, implemented, maintained and verified on a regular basis.
Title from Copilot: Authorised RF/IR device register for SECRET/TOP SECRET maintained

Description: Unauthorised RF and IR devices are not brought into SECRET and TOP SECRET areas.
Title from Copilot: Unauthorised RF/IR devices banned in SECRET/TOP SECRET areas

Description: Security measures are used to detect and respond to unauthorised RF devices in SECRET and TOP SECRET areas.
Title from Copilot: Detect/respond to unauthorised RF devices in SECRET/TOP SECRET areas

Description: An authorised photographic and video recording device register for SECRET and TOP SECRET areas is developed, implemented, maintained and verified on a regular basis.
Title from Copilot: Authorised photo/video device register maintained

Description: Unauthorised photographic and video recording devices are not brought into SECRET and TOP SECRET areas.
Title from Copilot: Unauthorised photo/video devices banned in SECRET/TOP SECRET areas

Description: An authorised medical device register for SECRET and TOP SECRET areas is developed, implemented, maintained and verified on a regular basis.
Title from Copilot: Authorised medical device register maintained

Description:
Medical devices that are authorised to be brought into SECRET and TOP SECRET areas meet, at a minimum, the following criteria:
• are listed on the Australian Register of Therapeutic Goods
• have been prescribed by a legally qualified medical practitioner
• have been commercially purchased within Australia
• do not have inbuilt cellular connectivity
• are capable of operating independently of mobile devices
• where possible, have Wi-Fi, Bluetooth and other forms of wireless connectivity disabled when operating within SECRET and TOP SECRET areas.
Title from Copilot: Criteria for authorised medical devices in secure areas

Description: Unauthorised medical devices are not brought into SECRET and TOP SECRET areas.
Title from Copilot: Unauthorised medical devices banned

Description: Unauthorised people are prevented from observing systems, in particular workstation displays and keyboards, within facilities.
Title from Copilot: Prevent unauthorised observation of systems/displays

Description: IT equipment and media are secured when not in use.
Title from Copilot: Secure IT equipment and media when not in use

Description:
Cyber security awareness training is undertaken annually by all personnel and covers:
• the purpose of the cyber security awareness training
• security appointments and contacts
• authorised use of systems and their resources
• protection of systems and their resources
• reporting of cyber security incidents and suspected compromises of systems and their resources.
Title from Copilot: Annual cyber awareness training for all personnel

Description: Tailored privileged user training is undertaken annually by all privileged users.
Title from Copilot: Annual privileged user training

Description: A cyber security awareness training register is developed, implemented and maintained.
Title from Copilot: Cyber awareness training register maintained

Description: Personnel dealing with banking details and payment requests are advised of what business email compromise is, how to manage such situations and how to report it.
Title from Copilot: Banking/payment staff trained on business email compromise

Description: Personnel dealing with user account details are advised of what social engineering attacks are, how to manage such situations and how to report them.
Title from Copilot: User-account staff trained on social engineering

Description: Personnel are advised of what suspicious contact via online services is and how to report it.
Title from Copilot: Personnel trained to report suspicious online contact

Description: Personnel are advised to not post work information to unauthorised online services and to report cases where such information is posted.
Title from Copilot: Personnel avoid posting work info to unauthorised services

Description: Personnel are advised to maintain separate work and personal user accounts for online services.
Title from Copilot: Personnel maintain separate work and personal accounts

Description: Personnel are advised of security risks associated with posting personal information to online services and are encouraged to use any available privacy settings to restrict who can view such information.
Title from Copilot: Personnel advised on personal info posting risks

Description: Personnel are advised not to send or receive files via unauthorised online services.
Title from Copilot: Personnel not to send/receive files via unauthorised services

Description: A system usage policy is developed, implemented and maintained.
Title from Copilot: System usage policy maintained

Description: A general-purpose artificial intelligence usage policy is developed, implemented and maintained.
Title from Copilot: AI usage policy maintained

Description: A web usage policy is developed, implemented and maintained.
Title from Copilot: Web usage policy maintained

Description: Access requirements for systems and their resources are documented in their system security plan.
Title from Copilot: Access requirements documented in system security plan

Description: Personnel undergo appropriate employment screening and, where necessary, hold an appropriate security clearance before being granted access to systems and their resources.
Title from Copilot: Employment screening and clearances before granting access

Description: Personnel receive any necessary briefings before being granted access to systems and their resources.
Title from Copilot: Personnel briefed before access granted

Description: Personnel agree to abide by system usage policies before being granted access to systems and their resources.
Title from Copilot: Personnel agree to system usage policies before access

Description: Personnel granted access to systems and their resources are uniquely identifiable.
Title from Copilot: Personnel are uniquely identifiable for access

Description: The use of shared user accounts is strictly controlled, and personnel using such accounts are uniquely identifiable.
Title from Copilot: Shared accounts strictly controlled and identifiable

Description: Personnel who are contractors are identified as such.
Title from Copilot: Contractor personnel identified as such

Description: Where systems process, store or communicate AUSTEO, AGAO or REL data, personnel who are foreign nationals are identified as such, including by their specific nationality.
Title from Copilot: Foreign nationals identified for certain sensitive data access

Description: Requests for unprivileged access to systems and their resources are validated when first requested.
Title from Copilot: Validate unprivileged access requests initially

Description: Unprivileged access to systems and their resources is limited to only what is required for users and services to undertake their duties.
Title from Copilot: Limit unprivileged access to required duties

Description: Use of unprivileged access is centrally logged.
Title from Copilot: Centrally log unprivileged access use

Description: Foreign nationals, including seconded foreign nationals, do not have access to systems that process, store or communicate AUSTEO or REL data unless effective controls are in place to ensure such data is not accessible to them.
Title from Copilot: Foreign nationals restricted from AUSTEO/REL systems without controls

Description: Foreign nationals, excluding seconded foreign nationals, do not have access to systems that process, store or communicate AGAO data unless effective controls are in place to ensure such data is not accessible to them.
Title from Copilot: Foreign nationals restricted from AGAO systems without controls

Description: Requests for privileged access to systems and their resources are validated when first requested.
Title from Copilot: Validate privileged access requests initially

Description: Privileged access to systems and their resources is limited to only what is required for users and services to undertake their duties.
Title from Copilot: Limit privileged access to required duties

Description: Privileged user accounts (excluding those explicitly authorised to access online services) are prevented from accessing the internet, email and web services.
Title from Copilot: Privileged accounts prevented from internet/email unless authorised

Description: Privileged user accounts explicitly authorised to access online services are strictly limited to only what is required for users and services to undertake their duties.
Title from Copilot: Privileged accounts with internet access strictly limited

Description: Just-in-time administration is used for the administration of systems and their resources.
Title from Copilot: Use just-in-time administration for system administration

Description: Privileged users are assigned a dedicated privileged user account to be used solely for duties requiring privileged access.
Title from Copilot: Privileged users assigned dedicated privileged accounts

Description: Unique privileged user accounts are used for administering individual server applications.
Title from Copilot: Unique privileged accounts for server app administration

Description: Privileged access events are centrally logged.
Title from Copilot: Privileged access events centrally logged

Description: Privileged user account and security group management events are centrally logged.
Title from Copilot: Privileged account/group management events logged

Description: Foreign nationals, including seconded foreign nationals, do not have privileged access to systems that process, store or communicate AUSTEO or REL data.

Description: Personnel are advised of the sensitivity or classification permitted for voice and data communications when using mobile devices.
Title from Copilot: Personnel advised of permitted sensitivity for mobile communications

Description:
Personnel are advised to take the following precautions when using mobile devices:
• never leave mobile devices or removable media unattended, including by placing them in checked-in luggage or leaving them in hotel safes
• never store credentials with mobile devices that they grant access to, such as in laptop computer bags
• never lend mobile devices or removable media to untrusted people, even if briefly
• never allow untrusted people to connect their mobile devices or removable media to your mobile devices, including for charging
• never connect mobile devices to designated charging stations or wall outlet charging ports
• never use gifted or unauthorised peripherals, chargers or removable media with mobile devices
• never use removable media for data transfers or backups that have not been checked for malicious code beforehand
• avoid reuse of removable media once used with other parties’ systems or mobile devices
• avoid connecting mobile devices to open or untrusted Wi-Fi networks
• consider disabling any communications capabilities of mobile devices when not in use, such as Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, Near Field Communication and ultra-wideband
• consider periodically rebooting mobile devices
• consider using a VPN connection to encrypt all cellular and wireless communications
• consider using encrypted email or messaging apps for all communications.
Title from Copilot: Mobile device travel precautions and hygiene guidance

• advised on how to apply and inspect tamper seals to key areas of mobile devices
• advised to avoid taking any personal mobile devices, especially if rooted or jailbroken.
Title from Copilot: High-risk country travel: provisioned travel devices and tamper seals

Description:
Before travelling overseas with mobile devices, personnel take the following actions:
• record all details of the mobile devices being taken, such as product types, serial numbers and International Mobile Equipment Identity numbers
• update all operating systems and applications
• remove all non-essential data, applications and user accounts
• backup all remaining data, applications and settings.
Title from Copilot: Pre-travel mobile device preparation checklist

Description:
Personnel report the potential compromise of mobile devices, removable media or credentials to their organisation as soon as possible, especially if they:
• provide credentials to foreign government officials
• decrypt mobile devices for foreign government officials
• have mobile devices taken out of sight by foreign government officials
• have mobile devices or removable media stolen, including if later returned
• lose mobile devices or removable media, including if later found
• observe unusual behaviour of mobile devices.
Title from Copilot: Report potential compromise of mobile devices promptly

Description:
Upon returning from travelling overseas with mobile devices, personnel take the following actions:
• sanitise and reset mobile devices, including all removable media
• decommission any credentials that left their possession during their travel
• report if significant doubt exists as to the integrity of any mobile devices or removable media.
Title from Copilot: Post-travel sanitise, reset credentials and report doubts

Description:
If returning from travelling overseas with mobile devices to high or extreme risk countries, personnel take the following additional actions:
• reset credentials used with mobile devices, including those used for remote access to their organisation’s systems
• monitor user accounts for any indicators of compromise, such as failed logon attempts.
Title from Copilot: Post-high-risk travel reset credentials and monitor accounts

Description:
